info.name: Payment Initiation Templates
info.description: Templates to be used for payment initations for private customers.

item.name: Lists templates that correspond with available payment products

request.description:
Access the template list endpoint to find all the supported payment products in the PSD2 API. Use the template id in list to receive a partially filled-in payment initiation request. Fill in the template fields and submit it in the payments endpoint to initiate a payment.
The scope field in the template list will indicate if each template is applicable for private or corporate scope.

item.name: The payment template is used so that the consumer of the API knows which fields they need to fill in when creating a payment inititation.

request.description:
Use the template id in the templates endpoint to receive a partially filled-in payment initiation request. All the field content that is prefixed with “TPP:” should be populated with the relevant data and remove the "TPP:" prefix.

The filled-in template can then be used as payment inititation payload. The name of the template will be used in the payments endpoint when creating the payment initiation, i.e. POST /payments/swedish-domestic-private-bankgiros

The templates are static so once a template has been fetched, it can be cached on the client side and be reused for future payments.

Note that the debtor account (sender) is always an IBAN for non-corporate payment types and the creditor account is dependent on the selected template (payment product). For corporate payment products sender is always a BBAN + BIC. The available debtor accounts can either be obtained from the customer or by using the accounts API.
